body.p: By default the DITA-OT plugin populates the 'note' ParaDef listLabel with the note icon corresponding to the note type.

The location of the folder containing note icons is controlled via the mmpdf:images.dir build parameter, and the icon file type may be set to any value (eg 'svg' or 'png') via the mmpdf:images.suffix build parameter. See
The baseline offset of the note image may be adjusted by modifying the noteimage FontDef, which defaults to a downshift of 20% of the note ParaDef fontsize, as shown here:
Note icons may be suppressed by unchecking the @listLabel attribute in the note or note_tbl ParaDef:
The size and positioning of the note icon is controlled through a combination of the ParaDef firstLineIndent, and the listLabel indent and width:

The properties of the icon graphic inserted may be overridden in a custom plugin by overriding the addNoteImage XSL template - see .
